bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR DERIVING DATA

abstract.p: Best bid and best offer rate data from deals concluded on an anonymous trading system in a fungible instrument such as a foreign currency pair are processed to derive indicative rates. A minimum indicative rates spread between bid and offer prices is defined. The indicative rate bide and offer prices are set to the received best bid and offer prices and alternatively an amount is added to the indicative offer rates and subtracted from the indicative bid rates until the spread between the indicative bid and offer rates is greater than or equal to the predefined minimum indicative rates spread and greater than the spread between the best bid and offer prices.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: System and method for deriving data

nplcit.text: - The U.K. Search Report issued Aug. 25, 2005
- The International Search Report issued for Parent PCT Application No. PCT/US2003/027333
Ref U-Clyde et al., Is it Efficient to impose costs on small-volume equity traders? International Journal of the Economics of Business, vol. 6, No. 1. 1999, pp. 81-92
Ref V-D. Freeman, Regional Tests of Okun's Law, International Advances in Economic Research, vol. 6, No. 3, p. 557, Aug. 2000

bibliographic-data.invention-title: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR DERIVING DATA
SYSTEME ET PROCEDE PERMETTANT DE DERIVER DES DONNEES

abstract.p: Best bid and best offer rate data from deals concluded on an anonymous trading system in a fungible instrument such as a foreign currency pair are processed to derive indicative rates. A minimum indicative rates spread between bid and offer prices is defined. The indicative rate bid and offer prices are set to the received best bid and offer prices and alternately an amount is added to the indicative offer rates and subtracted from the indicative bid rates until the spread between the indicative bid and offer rates is greater than or equal to the predefined minimum indicative rates spread and greater than the spread between the best bid and offer prices.

Selon l'invention, les données relatives aux meilleurs taux acheteur et vendeur provenant d'opérations conclues dans un système de transactions anonyme dans un instrument fongible tel qu'une paire de monnaies étrangères sont traitées afin de dériver les taux indicatifs. Un écart minimum en taux indicatifs entre les cours indicatifs acheteur et vendeur est défini. Les cours acheteur et vendeur en taux indicatifs sont indexés sur les meilleurs cours acheteur et vendeur reçus et, dans une variante, une certaine quantité est ajoutée aux taux vendeurs indicatifs et soustraite des taux acheteurs indicatifs jusqu'à ce que l'écart entre les taux indicatifs acheteur et vendeur soit supérieur ou égal à l'écart minimum en taux indicatifs et supérieur à l'écart entre les meilleurs cours acheteur et vendeur.
